Chicken Curry

Chicken curry is a delicious and popular dish made with chicken, curry powder, and a variety of other spices and ingredients. Here's a recipe for chicken curry that you can try at home:

Ingredients

  • 1 lb chicken thighs or breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
  • 2 tbsp vegetable oil
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 tbsp fresh ginger, minced
  • 2 tbsp curry powder
  • 1 tsp ground cumin
  • 1 tsp ground coriander
  • 1/2 tsp turmeric
  • 1 can (14 oz) coconut milk
  • 1 cup chicken broth
  • 1 pc red bell pepper
  • 1 pc green bell pepper
  • Salt and pepper, to taste
  • 1 pc carrot
  • 1 pc potato

    • Procedures

  • Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
  • In the same pan, Sauté the onion, garlic, ginger, bell peppers, carrot, and potato.
  • Add the curry powder, cumin, coriander, and turmeric, and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
  • Add the coconut milk and chicken broth, and stir to combine.
  • Return the chicken to the pan and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
  • Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  • Serve hot with steamed rice, and garnish with fresh cilantro if desired.
